definition: to covet/envious/jealous/green with envy/infuriated/furious
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
red/popular/revolutionary/bonus
surname Hong
when the enemies come face to face, their eyes blaze with hatred (idiom)
pinyin: chou2 ren2 xiang1 jian4 , fen4 wai4 yan3 hong2

sentences.english: Of course, many developing countries are envious of China's rise.
sentences.chinese: 當然，有很多發展中國家對天朝之崛起可謂分外眼紅。

sentences.english: Tom always flaunts his electronic productions. I really want to make him feel jealous once.
sentences.chinese: 總是炫耀他那些電子產品，我也想讓他嫉妒眼紅一回。

sentences.english: He looked disgustingly healthy when he got back from the Bahamas.
sentences.chinese: 他從巴哈馬羣島回來時看上去健康得令人眼紅。

sentences.english: The fact that there'll be a lot of money made by somebody doesn't bother me really.
sentences.chinese: 有很多人會賺到很多錢，但我真的不眼紅。

sentences.english: The share price China southern railway fell again, Buffett would be green with envy.
sentences.chinese: 中國南車股價再跌，巴菲特真要眼紅了。

sentences.english: Denis himself doesn't work hard, however, he is always green-eyed of other people's achievements.
sentences.chinese: 丹尼斯自己不努力，還老是眼紅別人的成就。

sentences.english: Chen Long see Yuan Hao, especially, people hang him up.
sentences.chinese: 陳龍看到袁浩，分外眼紅，讓人把他吊了起來。

sentences.english: He is green-eyed with his success.
sentences.chinese: 她對他的成功感到眼紅。

sentences.english: She is green-eyed with his success.
sentences.chinese: 她對他的成功感到眼紅。

sentences.english: Prince saw an enemy particularly jealous, spot called hand during the siege.
sentences.chinese: 太子一見仇人分外眼紅，當場招呼手下圍攻李世民。

sentences.english: BE during the days in the high school of sworn enemies, the personal enemy meet, cent outside jealous.
sentences.chinese: 原來是中學時的死對頭，仇人相見，分外眼紅。

definition: to come to sb's door/to call on sb
to make a fuss about nothing (idiom)
to incite disharmony/to instigate
to fight and scheme against each other (idiom)/(in palace construction) elaborate and refined
to be unable to breathe
lit. doesn't hurt, doesn't tickle (idiom); sth is wrong, but not quite sure what/fig. not getting to any matter of substance/scratching the surface/superficial/perfunctory
the cool eye of a bystander/a detached point of view
to gesticulate/to point out/to point the finger of blame
lit. to take joy in calamity and delight in disaster (idiom); fig. to rejoice in other people's misfortune/Schadenfreude
to hate/hatred/to resent/embittered
righteous indignation fills one's breast (idiom); to feel indignant at injustice
embarrassed
to come to blows/to paw/to grope/to get fresh
hard to understand/incomprehensible
well-tried/time-tested
to harbor evil designs/to harbor malicious intentions
